original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields up in mid-day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields were up in the mid-day trade on Wednesday as results of a bill auction is awaited, while the rupee traded at 321.50/322.00 against the US dollar, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 was quoted at 28.25/50 percent, up from 28.00/30 percent at Tuesday’s close.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 26.60/75 percent, slightly up from 26.50/70 percent yesterday. (Colombo/April26/2023)
